intro: Polygonella parksii, commonly known as the Colorado sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It typically grows in moist, rocky soils along streams and in mountainous regions. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers in early spring. It is characterized by its ability to thrive in harsh, high-altitude environments. Polygonella parksii plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
